name: Fume
headline: We are building the AI Software Developer
description:
We are building an AI software developer that can solve complex tasks.

All of those bugs, sentry errors, feature requests can now be handled by Fume now. Just report them over Slack and tag Fume under it. Fume will solve all of them in minutes.

If you find yourself copying and pasting code over to ChatGPT all the time, shoot me an email at emre@fumedev.com

founders.name: Emre Gucer, Founder
founders.description: co-founder and CEO @ Fume. former Northwestern student, now an LLM aficionado.

founders.name: Metehan Öz, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder and CTO @ Fume. A former NYU student. Now hacking around with LLMs.

## 
Engineering That Scales
### Test Everything
Engineers are not known for their meticulous testing. Fume will test for edge cases for each PR, understanding context around the changes.
### Scale Review
Most teams are bottlenecked by code review. Infintely scale your ability to review code as the team grows.
### Actionable Comments
Not only Fume reviews code, but it suggests multi-file, tested changes that you can commit with a single click.
## Shadow Engineering Workforce
Fume works silently in the background, handling the most tedious work for your team. Right now, it's testing but it will soon be able to do much more. For an AI agent with a computer, the sky is the limit.
### Review Your Way
Equip Fume with tribal knowledge via either playbooks or web recordings.
Frontend
PR #42
Testing Cron Jobs 101
SFPBPASG
### Dynamic Testing
Beyond static analysis, Fume actively tests your changes through its browser and command line. Double check by watching screen recordings attached to the review.
User Login Flow
2.3s
API Rate Limiting
1.1s
Edge Case: Network Timeout
3.5s
Database Rollback
0.8s
Mobile Responsive Layout
1.7s
### Full Codebase Context
Fume navigates your codebase just like an engineer - CMD + clicking its way through.
src/
auth/
auth.service.ts
types.ts
hooks/
useAuth.ts
### Computer Use
Fume is fully agentic and uses a computer to test and review your code.
Terminal Command
ran npm install @prisma/client
Web Action
clicked login button
File Edit
modified src/app/page.tsx
File Creation
created components/auth/login.tsx
Terminal Command
git commit -m "feat: add auth"
Web Action
opened settings menu
File Edit
updated prisma/schema.prisma
File Creation
added .env.local
### Everywhere you need
Communicate with Fume from anywhere you need. Web, Slack, Github, and more.
![Integration icon 2](https://fumedev.com/_next/image?url=%2Fmarketing%2Ffeatures%2Fslack.png&w=96&q=75)
![Integration icon 3](https://fumedev.com/_next/image?url=%2Fmarketing%2Ffeatures%2Fgithub.png&w=96&q=75)
YouFume
## Start Testing Everything With Fume
Set up Fume and start testing & reviewing all of your PRs today. Setup usually takes around 15 minutes. No waitlists or credit cards required.
  * Browser Testing
  * Unit Testing
  * Custom test scripts
  * Stylistic Feedback
  * Screen recordings attached to reviews
  * Full Codebase Understanding
  * Custom Instructions


## Team Plan
$30/engineer/month
Unlimited reivews
Custom review guides
Browser Testing
Playbooks & Web Recordings
Github Integration
Up to 10 parallel sessions
[Start Trial](https://fumedev.com/<https:/app.fumedev.com/signup>)
30 day free trial, no credit card required
## Frequently Asked Questions
Haven't found what you're looking for? Try [contacting](https://fumedev.com/</contact>) us, we are glad to help.
### What does Fume do?
### Is my code safe in Fume?
### Is my code used for training?
### What kind of integrations are available?
### How is Fume different than Devin AI?
### Who is Fume for?

### 
Ready to start?

' fit_markdown='' fit_html=''
generated_description:
Fume is an innovative startup aiming to reshape the landscape of software development with artificial intelligence. Founded in 2024 and a proud member of Y Combinator's W24 batch, Fume operates out of San Francisco with a compact team of two. Their mission? Building an AI software developer capable of tackling complex software tasks, making coding and debugging faster and easier.

Gone are the days of sifting through endless bugs and feature requests. With Fume, you simply tag them in Slack, and the AI works its magic—resolving issues in minutes. This kind of efficiency is appealing to any software team tired of the traditional, tedious processes. If you've ever found yourself cutting and pasting code into ChatGPT for help, Fume presents a seamless solution that doesn't require hopping between multiple platforms.

Fume provides its users the power to conduct rigorous testing without the usual headaches. The tool integrates into your workflow, allowing real-time testing of every code change, ensuring everything runs smoothly before merging. By scaling code reviews significantly, Fume transforms what’s often a bottleneck into a streamlined process, with actionable comments and multi-file changes ready to commit with just one click. They essentially offer a "shadow engineering workforce" that quietly handles the more tedious aspects of coding, leaving developers to focus on more impactful work.

For teams looking to benefit from Fume, they’ve rolled out a straightforward pricing model at $30 per engineer per month, which includes unlimited reviews and custom review guides. There's a 30-day free trial to get started, and setup takes just about 15 minutes.

They've caught the attention of over 100 teams, helping organizations like Hepsiburada and Mattermost ship code more effectively. With a robust set of features, including browser testing, unit testing, and custom scripts, Fume is positioned to redefine how developers interact with code, pushing the boundaries of what is possible with AI in software development. Curious to find out more? Check them out at [fumedev.com](https://fumedev.com) or reach out via email at emre@fumedev.com.
